alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 29 at 9:02PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...MIXED PRECIPITATION EXPECTED UNTIL MONDAY MORNING FOR THE MATANUSKA VALLEY... Precipitation is moving north through Cook Inlet this afternoon. Mixed precipitation including snow, sleet, and freezing rain/drizzle is being observed for the Western Kenai Peninsula and Anchorage. This band will continue north into the Matanuska Valley. Low confidence exists with regards to precipitation type as the band moves into cooler, but still slightly drier and warmer air aloft. Locations that are more likely to see a wintry mix would be from around Willow south through Big Lake and Wasilla. Any precipitation that falls as liquid will freeze to surfaces and roads that are near or below freezing. Temperatures will continue to be cool enough through the morning to impact the Monday morning commute. Please plan ahead for slippery road conditions, slow down, and use caution while traveling.
